website_summaries.verdict: The Ally Plus is a great Wi-Fi system for any large home but it suits families with both novice and advanced users especially well.
pros: The Ally Plus broadcasts fast Wi-Fi coverage over a large area
It includes both a well-designed mobile app and an in-depth web interface, plus more features than other competing home mesh systems
cons: The system doesn't have a dedicated backhaul band and you can't connect the extender unit to the router unit via a network cable to improve performance

customer_reviews.title: Better range than prior router, frustrating to work with
customer_reviews.text: This network setup has extended my wifi range beyond what my single ASUS router was achieving, so from that standpoint it's worked out well. Semi-advanced settings like static IPs and port forwarding are available, though accessing them is a little weird (just not where I would expect in the menus). The problem is that many of my devices now frequently require me to disable and reenable their wifi in order to stay connected. My iPad is the worst...sometimes it requires this process once every couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Worked good until the cloud server went down.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I purchased back in February based on a #3 of best 2020 mesh routers to get. It states up to 15,000 sq feet of range. I have trouble just going in the garage of a 2500 sq/ft house and the extender is in the room above the garage. Biggest problem now is that the server is down and any device I blocked, I cannot unblock because the server is down. Cannot make ANY changes to router. I feel a little cheated and now have to look for another alternative.
customer_reviews.author: T-rock

customer_reviews.title: Useless with a Roku device
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work well but does not detect ROKU devices making the product useless. Seemed to be fairly user friendly to set up other than that frustration. Amped Support was useless and not worth the time talking to them as they told me it must be the ROKU devices. The devices did connect to the WiFi and were working correctly, just the router could not detect them on the network. It worked fine with a Firestick and ipads and phones
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great speeds, great experience
customer_reviews.text: Finally have rock solid wifi throughout my house. 2700 square feet covered easily and setup was easy. Replaced a linksys ac1200 and couldn't be happier. really like that the app tells you when a new device has connected to the network. Very fast and seemless!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware but horrible software
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware, but crappy software and zero technical support. Stay away from this product till it is commercially ready. When I faced an issue where the Internet works, but the app says "ally is off-line", I called Technical support thinking they can help. The rep says, "sorry the app is buggy and there is no solution to the problem. Try resetting the router to factory default and re-configure". Pathetic!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cure woes with Wireless Service, Not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to work as I expected it to. However, may be my setup that is incorrect. My devices keep going back to my original server. I am unclear as to getting it set up. Would seem as though I need both ATT and ALLY to each have an address. Also stops me from going any sites that have card games, word games and more. Unless I get better information from someone I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: spacer1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to setup, app is easy to use, and looks well built. AVG scanning built in (Not aware if it actually does anything however). Cons: Poor range compared to some other systems (Average at best). Barely covers a 1500 sq ft split level home. Some latency issues compared to other mesh networks I have tested (Probably due to the AVG scanning).
customer_reviews.author: Data Pro

customer_reviews.title: 💩💩💩  Began to fail just after warrantee expires
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about a year. Then began to fail just after warranty expires. Designed to be controlled by SmartPhone app. Smartphone app no longer works. Cannot detect router's connection to Internet. Other services — such as Apple TV — next failed to recognize internet connection. Reset and reconfigured multiple times, to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hamlett

customer_reviews.title: Extender doesn't work, tech support is bad, replacement policy is worse
customer_reviews.text: The extender stopped working within days. The tech support number leaves you on hold for 30 minutes each time you call. They tell me they have to issue an RMA to replace this unit that I have had for less than a month. But they don't ship me a new one, I have to ship them this one and be without internet for as long as it takes for them to receive it, and THEN they will ship me a replacement. Horrible support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not a good buy for us. We had to return it. We live in a adobe/cinder block home and it actually slowed our internet down. We were bummed. It was easy to install, we just couldn’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine until a few months later the app told me to update the firmware. Router has been worthless ever since. I have tried calling tech support and the 1 time I got through they told me to hard reset the router. That has been no help and now all I get a busy signals when I call. Apparently, I wasted $300 on the POS.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Speed

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctions!
customer_reviews.text: After some 4 months of use it has started to malfunction almost on a daily basis. Has to be unplugged for 30 seconds and powered up again. Aggravating! Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: leica1925

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, excellent performance. Finally have full house wireless coverage without issues moving between rooms. Web filtering feature needs work, but I don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Cruse

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. the device continually goes off line for no reason and there is no customer service. the hours are posted on the website but all you can do is leave a message! utterly disappointed with it and with CNET's positive review Bottom line is that it's no better than my Verizon Gateway.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Eskay Eagle

customer_reviews.title: quit working in 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: The first problem was there was no prompt to add a password. then it would drop the connection and finally quit altogether It is setting in the closet floor unplugged and dead
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: AMPED servers inconsistent. Down 3 weeks in a row.  Product Unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this product, I contacted customer service 3 times over 3 weeks. Each time I was told that "their servers were down." The outage was approximately 4 days each time. When the servers are out, the app for controlling the wifi is unusable. I strongly recommend against purchasing this device.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas T. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Good product - very fair price
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble setting up system. Initially also had trouble contacting support. However, once I got to a support person he was very helpful. The system works well for a very reasonable cost. I particularly like the fact that there are 3 extra ethernet ports on the main router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, reliable and speedy performance. No "wholes" in the apartment at all.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe Mazzeo

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with non iOS devices
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Does not connect reliably with iOS devices. One of my ipads gets disconnected frequently. Works fine with non iOS devices.
customer_reviews.author: Murali Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Product works well! Not able to trouble shoot setting ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works well! Not able to trouble shoot setting up poduct from the app, if you have issues as I did. Did a reset and it eventually came around and worked. It is a fast strong and stable connection! Have had close to 25 devices connected and all work well in 7000 sqft house!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than basic router and easy basic setup.
customer_reviews.text: Good coverage. Need to have good understanding and take your time to setup. You can create different account for 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz as well for guest on both speed. It's very easy to basic setup, but bit of patience to have more user setup control.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Utley

customer_reviews.title: Does not offer credible tech help!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for less than a year and it stopped working. Called the tech support, could not find out what was wrong with it. No help and no interest in helping.I thought it was still under warranty. But they did not have my registration of the product. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is impresive!!! I didn't know that I had this connection speed and it is all over the house. Easy setup. Awesome parental controls.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Unable to connect 80% of the time
customer_reviews.text: Drops WiFi signal all the time forcing us to “forget this network” and reconnect. The answer from the company is to reboot. Would never ever buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Amped not an Ally
customer_reviews.text: Kept having to reconnect. Description says it would cover up to 15000 square ft, barely got 2000 to 2500 square ft. Would have been happy with 3500 to 4000.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Broke at 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Power turns off now. After 5 months broken Lame !
customer_reviews.author: Laser Locked

customer_reviews.title: this does not  even cover an 8,000 sq ft house, your ad say it cover a 15,000 sf house
customer_reviews.text: my extender is always red even if it is in the say room as the router.
customer_reviews.author: Ada

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't block search content, only url's
customer_reviews.text: does not block internet search content. only blocks websites. for example, if you do a search for porn, some really awful stuff comes up, but if you go to porn.com, it blocks it. Content should also be blocked in searches.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Laws

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Setting this up was very easy! The tech support was wonderful to work with when I had questions about the app. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: App does not work and can’t be fixed
customer_reviews.text: Hardware works on for a few days then you have to hard reset The ally app is useless it never will connect so all the great features it has are never available to use. The app has terrible ratings in the App Store and rightly so and they haven’t even tried to update the app in years Do not buy ! Amazon should pull this product off of Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, overall excellent experience with the product
customer_reviews.text: It took abut 15 minutes to set everything up with the mobile app and all my devices connected without any hiccups. I have read many of the reviews about the app being sub-optimal but I actually had no trouble with it what so ever during the installation or using the app afterward to make setting changes. It really was quite easy and I'm not very tech savvy. Coverage for my 1 story 3000 sq ft home is very good everywhere. Stable connections so far. No dead zones. Excellent wifi speed (I have a 200 mbps plan). So far so good. I'm very happy with this product. Deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: This system is the best -- and incredibly simple to set up. Thank you, Developers!
customer_reviews.text: This is, by a long way, the easiest WiFi setup I've ever had -- and that includes Apple's routers, which were the previous winners. Everything is labeled as to what goes where -- even the adapters. The app is clear, and has some fabulous features, including letting me know as soon as new device is connected. That really helped when setting up all my Smart Home devices. The extender works very well. There are areas that were completely dead before where I can now get enough bandwidth to even stream video. I couldn't be happier. Fantastic system. Kudos to the developers.
customer_reviews.author: lapis

customer_reviews.title: Still working and no issues so far
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues in setup or functionality of the device. Setup through the app was simple and quick and i still do not have any issues in its performance. Through the app you can control and block certain activities, particularly useful when you have kids. The range is also very good, with no issues in/around the house or outside of it. But I don't have a lot of complexities in setting up my network so many of the advanced functionalities, I cannot attest to.
customer_reviews.author: FoodPornDirector

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: After having this for almost two years I can say it is mediocre at best. It has parental controls, website blocking, etc... which is great...if it worked. I try to ‘pause’ internet access for certain users but it does not work. Blocking certain websites does not work. The app does not work (usually). I’m not one for negative reviews and really wanted to like this product.. we will continue to use it at home because we have nothing else and it was not cheap. Those are the only reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent-EASY to install, works great
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up I couldn't believe it--had my "Techie" brother in law on call in anticipation of having issues-NONE, totally smooth install. Only issue I have is one extender was showing green, but then our ROKU movie stopped in the middle-I unplugged the extender and plugged it back in, then it showed red, but ROKU worked fine. Other than that-I totally recommend this Router! FIVE STARS
customer_reviews.author: Jean Turicik

customer_reviews.title: Free of dead spots and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have this covering a 4000sqft home. It eplaced a Nighthawk ac1900. Free of dead spots and easy to use. Parental controls are fantastic for curfews down to the device level. Simple to use and set up. Have 30 or so devices connected including a bunch of wifi speakers and connected tvs with no lagging.
customer_reviews.author: BillyP

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time, energy and money
customer_reviews.text: Not sure show Ally is selling this junk. Every 3 days need to restart the system; all of a sudden one after another devices will loose the connection. Unreliable waste product. Stay away from this junk and save yourself from wasting time, energy and money.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisY

customer_reviews.title: Good features but needs refinement
customer_reviews.text: Good features but mediocre signal increase. Also sporadic drop of signal and bad handoff between bands. Returning and going with Google WiFi even though I greatly prefer the parental controls on this setup. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit with the extender hoping to add it to my existing network for more coverage. This unit is nothing more than an entry level router for the network ILLITERATE!!! You'd think for the money spent there would be more flexibility. I get more out of a cheap 20.00 router than this 300.00 setup. There is no customization available whatsoever except for a few web filters. It's truly an awful under developed system!
customer_reviews.author: thedoc

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line Secyrity and Operation
customer_reviews.text: What I really like about the Amped Wireless Ally Plus is the excellent security. Alerts and alarms are available for a number of uses, including banned websites, etc. Easy to set up. Superior power and range, even for a large home. Genuinely top of the line and state of the art!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kear

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for me. I tried to set ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for me. I tried to set it up, the Ally app from my phone kept on saying "can't connect to the server"."Server is unavailable. I plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: TJG

customer_reviews.title: ... Amped cameras during Black Friday promotions and they work great. I'm no techy but my son is and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the Amped cameras during Black Friday promotions and they work great. I'm no techy but my son is and I was able to set this up myself without his help. He was pretty amazed to say the least. I just plugged the units in and followed the steps after getting the app. The phone app is very useful and lets you do a lot of things like pause internet for dinner and best of all block facebook if needed. The wifi performance is good and now provides us coverage all over and in our backyard. Couldn't be happier with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mom2002

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Happy with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This system took me less than five minutes to set up....from my iPhone. A true, modern day experience. No website to punch in, no IP address to keep track of, just as simple as an app download & following a few steps. It was literally easier than figuring out how to use Snapchat. Our daughter isn't quite old enough for the parental controls, but they will come in handy very soon. We're more than satisfied w/ the wi-fi speed & coverage. Smart TVs have no trouble streaming (we are a 100% streaming household), music plays with no problems. We have about 8 devices connected, at any given time, it's working great.
customer_reviews.author: LLN

product_meta.title: Amped ALLY-0091K Wireless Ally Plus, Whole Home Smart Wi-Fi System
product_meta.description: Style:ALLY PLUS - Router + ExtenderALLY is a Whole Home Smart Wi-Fi System that will transform the way your family experiences Wi-Fi. It's capable of up to 15,000 sq. ft. of smart, safe, secure Wi-Fi that is designed with the whole family in mind. Controlled by an App, ALLY gives full control over how and when the internet is used, and who gets to use it. With an added layer of web security by AVG.
feature_bullets: Router + Extender - With the 2-pack ALLY Plus, you can get Wi-Fi in every room of your home - even the patio. It’s Wi-Fi up to 15,000 sq ft, without dead zones, dropped signals or disruptions.
Parental Controls - Manage what your kids see online by blocking access to specific content or apps with the ALLY App. Set Wi-Fi schedules for each child or pause the Wi-Fi during homework & dinner.
Reports & Alerts - See a report of your kids’ online activity so you can keep a tab on them. Get alerts when flagged sites are visited & block unknown devices that try to connect to your Wi-Fi.
Secured by AVG - Protect the devices on your network from Malware and phishing attacks by blocking harmful websites. Built in security from the experts at AVG. Schedule Online Time with Curfews
Blazing Fast Wi-Fi - Stream HD and 4K videos, game without lag and more - on multiple devices at once with incredibly Fast AC1900 Wi-Fi speeds. Wire in devices at the same speed with Gigabit Ports.
NOTE: Check User Guide on Technical Specification before use

specifications.Wireless Type: 5.8 GHz Radio Frequency, 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.7 out of 5 stars94 ratings2.7 out of 5 stars
